metadata.name: zyncx
metadata.description: Privacy-preserving vault system with confidential computation on Solana

instructions.name: confidential_swap_callback
docs: Callback for confidential_swap computation

instructions.name: create_encrypted_vault
docs: Create a new encrypted vault with Arcium MXE

instructions.name: init_confidential_swap_comp_def
docs: Initialize the confidential_swap computation definition

instructions.name: init_process_deposit_comp_def
docs: Initialize the process_deposit computation definition

instructions.name: init_vault_callback
docs: Callback for init_vault computation

instructions.name: init_vault_comp_def
docs: Initialize the init_vault computation definition

instructions.name: process_deposit_callback
docs: Callback for process_deposit computation

instructions.name: queue_confidential_swap
docs: Queue a confidential swap via Arcium MXE

instructions.name: queue_encrypted_deposit
docs: Queue an encrypted deposit via Arcium MXE

errors.name: InvalidDepositAmount
errors.msg: Invalid deposit amount - must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidWithdrawalAmount
errors.msg: Invalid withdrawal amount - must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidSwapAmount
errors.msg: Invalid swap amount - must be greater than zero

errors.name: InvalidFeeAmount
errors.msg: Invalid fee amount - must be greater than zero

errors.name: VaultNotFound
errors.msg: Vault not found for the specified asset

errors.name: VaultAlreadyRegistered
errors.msg: Vault already registered for this asset

errors.name: AmountMismatch
errors.msg: Amount mismatch between expected and received

errors.name: NativeFundReceived
errors.msg: Native fund received for alternative asset deposit

errors.name: MaxDepthReached
errors.msg: Merkle tree has reached maximum depth

errors.name: InvalidPublicInputs
errors.msg: Invalid public inputs for ZK proof

errors.name: InvalidComputationStatus
errors.msg: Invalid computation status for this operation

errors.name: ComputationNotExpired
errors.msg: Computation has not expired yet - cannot cancel

types.name: ClockAccount
docs: An account storing the current network epoch

types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount
docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta
docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.

types.name: ComputationSignature
docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].

types.name: ConfidentialSwapOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: EncryptedVaultAccount
docs: Encrypted vault state - stores MXE-encrypted aggregate data
Memory layout:
[0..8]     Anchor discriminator
[8]        bump (1 byte)
[9..41]    token_mint (Pubkey, 32 bytes)
[41..73]   authority (Pubkey, 32 bytes)
[73..89]   nonce (u128, 16 bytes)
[89..185]  encrypted_state (3  32 bytes = 96 bytes encrypted state)

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump seed

fields.name: token_mint
docs: Token mint this vault manages

fields.name: authority
docs: Vault authority

fields.name: nonce
docs: Nonce for MXE re-encryption (updated by every callback)

fields.name: encrypted_state
docs: Encrypted vault state: [pending_deposits, total_liquidity, total_deposited]
Each is an Enc<Mxe, u64> - 32 bytes per ciphertext

types.name: Epoch
docs: The network epoch

types.name: InitVaultOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: MXEAccount
docs: A MPC Execution Environment.

types.name: MxeStatus
docs: The status of an MXE.

types.name: NodeMetadata
docs: location as [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

types.name: NodeRef
docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
epoch.

types.name: Output
docs: An output of a computation.
We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
data objects.

types.name: Parameter
docs: A parameter of a computation.
We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.

types.name: ProcessDepositOutput
docs: The output of the callback instruction. Provided as a struct with ordered fields
as anchor does not support tuples and tuple structs yet.

types.name: SetUnset
docs: Utility struct to store a value that needs to be set by a certain number of participants (keys
in our case). Once all participants have set the value, the value is considered set and we only
store it once.
